Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of PlasmaJet in Cytoreductive Surgery for Advanced Ovarian Cancer

Participants.evidence: 327 patients with FIGO stage IIIB–IV epithelial ovarian cancer

Intervention.evidence: undergo primary or interval CRS with (intervention) or without (control) PlasmaJet

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated whether the adjuvant use of a neutral argon plasma device (PlasmaJet) improves the rate of complete cytoreductive surgery (CRS) in advanced-stage ovarian cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of complete CRS, measured immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using block randomisation with stratification

Blinding.evidence: patients were blinded to group allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: From February 2018 to September 2020, 190 patients were randomised to the intervention group and 193 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Per-protocol analysis showed 85.6% in the intervention group versus 71.5% in the control group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Complete CRS was achieved in 75.8% of the intervention group and 67.6% of the control group (risk difference 8.2%, 95% CI –0.021 to 0.181; P = 0.131).

Harms.evidence: No significant differences in adverse events were observed.
